intro: Thlaspi roseolum, commonly known as the rose moss or pink rockcress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial that typically forms a dense mat of foliage, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or white, which bloom in early spring. Its leaves are generally fleshy and succulent, adapted to retain moisture in arid environments. Thlaspi roseolum is often used in rock gardens and alpine settings due to its ornamental value and hardy nature.
